intro: Krascheninikovia koidzumiana, commonly known as the Koidzumi's krascheninikovia, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically borne on long, slender pedicels. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, with a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh conditions. Krascheninikovia koidzumiana is often found in rocky soils and is a component of the vegetation in high-altitude regions.
